pulltitle: Adding back bootstrap 3.0, as 2.3 broke home menu and several other styles, while fixing some styles.
pullsbody:
Sorry for touching up so many layout things. I didn't see a reason why we switched out bootstrap after seeing how many small things it breaks. Seems like everything is working as expected with 3.0 with small changes that also simplify code. Can you confirm, @ednapiranha?
- bootstrap.css is a custom build (fonts, colors, etc): http://getbootstrap.com/customize/?id=6582440
- Styled typeahead following the menu drop down
- Fixed @media queries to show background and splash screen
- Grid might need some adjustment since I removed the max-width on .container. We could also achieve that with a bootstrap custom build.
pull_repo_desc: Persona-driven cross-platform hugs for the community
pull_commit_message:
Adding back bootstrap 3.0, as 2.3 broke home menu and several other styles, while fixing some styles.

- bootstrap.css is a custom build (fonts, colors, etc): http://getbootstrap.com/customize/?id=6582440
- Styled typeahead following the menu drop down
- Fixed @media queries to show background and splash screen
- Grid might need some adjustment since I removed the max-width on .container. We could also achieve that with a bootstrap custom build.

pulltitle: Ready to rock staccato, with config and cron jobs.
pullsbody:
- local.json config for stackato (ask @digitarald for it if you want to push your own)
- redis config in all files (might get consolidated)
- cron jobs scheduled when app starts
- async module for cron jobs, to simplify code and to exit correctly even on error

@ednapiranha r?
pull_repo_desc: Persona-driven cross-platform hugs for the community
pull_commit_message:
Ready to rock staccato, with config and cron jobs.

- local.json config for stackato (ask @digitarald for it if you want to push your own)
- redis config in all files (might get consolidated)
- cron jobs scheduled when app starts
- async module for cron jobs, to simplify code and to exit correctly even on error

pulltitle: validate persona user by email upon signin
pullsbody:
I also changed all the tabs to spaces on some of those lines :)

Behaviour in this login flow is the following:
1. If user exists in mozillians vouched list, they get to the logged in page
2. If user doesn't exist, then they get back the persona signin

bring mozillians/angular client into firehug
